definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)
honorific title during Tang to Qing times, approx. "Glorious grand master"
tutor to the crown prince (in imperial China)
to give to the departed/to confer (a title) posthumously
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
Minister of imperial stud, originally charged with horse breeding
posthumous name or title/to confer a posthumous title
to appoint sb to a post or confer a title on sb by imperial order
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
to join the nobility/to rise through the nobility
Minister of Revenue (from the Han dynasty onwards)
